definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
character having several readings and meanings

sentences.english: The ambiguity is the conscientious pursuit of the Tarkovsky's films.
sentences.chinese: 多義性是塔爾科夫斯基電影的自覺追求。

sentences.english: Finally, the cohesion and coherence of discourse also have an impact on the translation of polysemic words.
sentences.chinese: 同時，語篇的銜接與連貫也作用於多義詞的翻譯。

sentences.english: The third talks about polysemy and its relation to homonymy , etc.
sentences.chinese: 第三節闡釋了多義現象以及多義和同音的關係等。

sentences.english: The third talks about polysemy and its relation to homonymy , etc.
sentences.chinese: 第三節闡釋了多義現象以及多義和同音的關係等。

sentences.english: Ability to communicate across team borders is limited by the ambiguity of natural language.
sentences.chinese: 跨團隊交流的能力受到自然語言的多義性的限制。

sentences.english: A:Let me see. Oh, its polysemous word.
sentences.chinese: 我來看看，哦，這是個多義詞。

sentences.english: Paradox is a polysemy with several layers of concepts.
sentences.chinese: “悖論”是一個多義詞，表達着多個概念。

sentences.english: Polysemy is a common phenomenon in different languages.
sentences.chinese: 一詞多義是各種語言中的普遍現象。

sentences.english: As a universal phenomenon of language . Polysemy calls the attention of linguists.
sentences.chinese: 作爲語言的普遍現象，一詞多義引起語言學家的重視。

sentences.english: If there is ambiguity, you can select from several alternatives.
sentences.chinese: 如果存在多義性，則可以從幾個選項中選擇。
多義詞是語言中的普遍現象。

sentences.english: In their research, the prepositional polysemy takes important place.
sentences.chinese: 在他們的領域裏，介詞多義研究佔據重要地位。

sentences.english: All this results in poly-meaning of art acceptance.
sentences.chinese: 這一切都造成了藝術接受的多義性。

sentences.english: This cloak-and-dagger and charming a plentifulness for still consisting in it with many righteousnesses.
sentences.chinese: 這部小說的迷人之處還在於它的豐富與多義。

sentences.english: Multi- or even mis-interpretations exist in media communication.
sentences.chinese: 媒介傳播存在一定程度的多義甚至歧義現象。

sentences.english: Polysemy is a pervasive phenomenon in human language.
sentences.chinese: 一詞多義是人類語言中存在的普遍現象。

definition: language component/morpheme/individual characters (making up an expression)
part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
hard to tell if it's real or sham
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
